intro: Isometrum wanshanense, commonly known as the Wanshan isometrum, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, and is adapted to temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive aromatic scent, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
